TextView.android:text: VENUS- The Second Planet from the Sun

Basic Information:
Type: Terrestrial planet
Order from Sun: 2nd planet
Distance from Sun: ~108.2 million km (~0.72 AU)
Diameter: 12,104 km (slightly smaller than Earth)
Mass: ~4.867 × 10²⁴ kg (about 81.5% of Earth's mass)
Gravity: 8.87 m/s² (about 90% of Earth's gravity)

Orbital And Rotational Characteristics:
Revolution period (around Sun): 224.7 Earth days
Rotation period (on its own axis): 243 Earth days (longest rotation period in the Solar System)
Orbital Speed: 35.02 km/s
Axial Tilt: 177.4° (rotates in the opposite direction compared to most planets)
Orbital Eccentricity: 0.0067 (almost circular orbit)

Moons And Rings:
Number of Moons: 0 (Venus has no natural satellites)
Number of Rings: 0

Surface And Atmosphere:
Surface Temperature:
Average: ~464°C (867°F) (hottest planet in the Solar System, even hotter than Mercury)
Surface Composition: Volcanic plains, highland regions, large impact craters
Atmosphere Type: Thick and dense, composed mostly of carbon dioxide
Main Gases in Atmosphere: Carbon dioxide (CO₂) ~96.5%, Nitrogen (N₂) ~3.5%, trace amounts of sulfur dioxide (SO₂), argon (Ar), and water vapor
Weather Conditions: Runaway greenhouse effect traps extreme heat, thick clouds of sulfuric acid create acid rain, strong winds up to 360 km/h (224 mph) in the upper atmosphere, surface pressure ~92 times Earth's (equivalent to being 900 meters underwater)
